Am 04.04.10 13:26, schrieb Bob Haugen:
>  
> 
> My understanding of REST is that the stateless constraint is on the
> server, not the client.

I think you're not correct. REST only adovcates no _shared_
conversational state between client and server.

The client can be statefull (e.g. the current loaded resource).
The server typically will be statefull (the state of the served resources).

-billy.
